task.name: slsearch

param.name: tablename
param.description: Input spectral line table name to search. If not specified, use the default table in the system.

param.name: outfile
param.description: Results table name. Blank means do not write the table to disk.

param.name: qns
param.description: Resolved quantum numbers to search for.

param.name: rrlinclude
param.description: Include RRLs in the result set?

param.name: rrlonly
param.description: Include only RRLs in the result set?

param.name: list
param.description: List result set to logger (and optionally logfile)?

param.name: logfile
param.description: List result set to this logfile (only used if list=True).

param.name: append
param.description: If true, append to logfile if it already exists, if false overwrite logfile it it exists. Only used if list=True and logfile not blank.

param.name: wantreturn
param.description: If true, return the spectralline tool associated with the result set.

task.example: Search the specfied spectral line table. The return value (if wantreturn=true) is a spectralline tool with a new table containing the search results. This new table can be written to disk by specifying its name in the outfile parameter. If outfile is not specified (ie outfile=""), the resulting table is held in memory and deleted upon a call to close() or done() for the newly created tool or upon exiting casapy if wantreturn=True or immediately upon completion of task execution if wantreturn=False. Because Splatalogue does not have values for intensity, smu2, loga, eu, and el for radio recombination lines (rrls), one must specify to include rrls in the specified frequency range in the output. In this case, RRLs will be included ignoring any filters on intensity, smu2, loga, eu, and el. One can also specify to list only RRLs. One can specify to list the search results to the logger via the list parameter. If list is Galse, no logger output is listed, although the results can be listed later by running the list() method on the newly created spectral line tool if wantreturn=True. If list=True, one can also specify that the results be listed to a logfile and if this file already exists, one can specify that the results be appended to it or to overwrite it with the results. \begin{verbatim} slrestool = slsearch("myspectrallines.tbl", list=False) # do a search postponing listing the results to the logger. slrestool = sl.search(outfile="myresults.tbl", freqrange = [200,300], species=['HOCN', 'HOCO+']) # now list the results slrestool.list() # or one could also do the following after exiting and restarting casapy sl.open("myresults.tbl") sl.list() \end{verbatim}
